Title: Enterprise architecture design using togaf framework in CV Widjojo
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Science and Technology
Affiliations: Information System Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Valentinus, Information System Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Legowo, N., Information System Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: One important strategy in dealing with the development of information technology is the utilization and improvement of information systems support for the enterprise. This research was conducted at CV Widjojo. The governance of the implementation of information systems, the use of information technology and data management have not been maximized yet. A design is needed for the development of IT / IS governance in CV Widjojo. This study discusses how the process of developing Enterprise Architecture in CV Widjojo and how the analysis of the design results can be a reference for the development of IT / IS governance for the next few years. The method used in this research is TOGAF ADM. Preliminary phase analysis, vision architecture phase, business architecture phase, system information phase, technology architecture phase, opportunities and solution phase, and migration planning are carried out in describing the existing conditions and building the target architecture. The data in this study were obtained by conducting interviews, observation and study of literature. The results of this study in the form of a recommended enterprise architecture design, solutions to problems, and IT roadmap based on the analysis that has been done. © 2020 SERSC.

Authors: Novianti E., Dennis, Valentinus, Oktaviandrie Y.F., Richard M., Hutagaol B.J., Fajar A.N., Retnowardhani A.
Title: SOA System for Commerce Transaction in Indonesia: I-HEMAT
Source title: Proceedings of the International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Informatics
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Darma Persada University, Information System Department, Radin Inten II Street, Jakarta, Indonesia; BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Novianti, E., Faculty of Engineering, Darma Persada University, Information System Department, Radin Inten II Street, Jakarta, Indonesia; Dennis, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Valentinus, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktaviandrie, Y.F., BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Richard, M., BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hutagaol, B.J., BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fajar, A.N., BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Retnowardhani, A., BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) is a paradigm for organizing and utilizing distributed capabilities, SOA has been adapted as information technology to help selling and shopping activity in separate platform and complicated activity become one place. Customer in Indonesia looking for a best quality product with a lowest price, so we proposed SOA to build a website with a concept one stop shopping for people in Indonesia. It's helps customer to find a product, compare the product, searching for a promotion and also view the review from other people from social media and other platform. And it's help seller to promote their product, so their promotion can reach target customer. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-Commerce Transaction; ESB; Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
Index Keywords: Information services; Sales; Indonesia; Lowest price; One stop; Quality product; Shopping activity; Social media; Service oriented architecture (SOA)
